item.title: 全球严阵以待关税影响，苹果业绩超预期
item.description: 由于担心美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）可能会对苹果公司的标志性设备征收进口税，消费者纷纷囤积iPhone手机，苹果公司周四公布的财报显示，其业绩险胜华尔街预期。【原文：Apple on Thursday reported results that narrowly beat Wall Street expectations as consumers stocked up on iPhones amid fears of potential import taxes on its signature device from President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 保险公司 AIG 的利润因洛杉矶野火损失而下降
item.description: 美国国际集团周四公布第一季度利润下降，原因是 1 月份洛杉矶发生的大火烧毁了 16,000 多座建筑，导致巨灾损失增加。【原文：American International Group reported lower first-quarter profit on Thursday, as the inferno that scorched more than 16,000 structures in Los Angeles in January led to higher catastrophe losses.】

item.title: Atlassian 预测季度收入不佳，股价下跌
item.description: 由于企业客户在严峻的经济形势下削减了云软件服务支出，Atlassian 周四预测第四季度营收低于预期。【原文：Atlassian forecast fourth-quarter revenue below estimates on Thursday, as enterprise customers cut spending on cloud software services in a tough economy.】

item.title: 安进公司季度利润高于华尔街预期，销售额增长 11
item.description: 安进公司周四表示，由于产品销售额增长 11%，利润率扩大，公司第一季度利润增长 24%，大大超出华尔街预期。【原文：Amgen on Thursday said its first-quarter profit rose 24%, handily exceeding Wall Street expectations, as product sales increased 11% and profit margins widened.】

item.title: 受经济不确定性影响，Roku 预计第二季度收入低于预期
item.description: 由于客户在不确定的市场环境中缩减开支，Roku 周四预测第二季度营收低于华尔街预期，导致该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌 4%。【原文：Roku forecast second-quarter revenue below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as customers pull back spending amid an uncertain market environment, sending shares of the company down 4% in extended trading.】

item.title: 因担心支出放缓，布洛克下调 2025 年展望
item.description: 周四，支付公司布洛克（Block）下调了 2025 年毛利润增长的指导目标，导致该公司股价在盘后交易中下跌了 10%。【原文：Payments firm Block cut its guidance for 2025 gross profit growth on Thursday, sending the company's shares down 10% in extended trading.】

item.title: Airbnb预计第二季度营收低于预期，表明美国旅游需求疲软
item.description: 度假租赁平台 Airbnb 周四预测第二季度营收将大幅低于华尔街预期，并表明美国需求疲软，因为反复无常的贸易政策打击了消费者情绪，引发了对经济增长的担忧。【原文：Vacation rental platform Airbnb on Thursday forecast second-quarter revenue largely below Wall Street estimates and signaled softening demand in the U.S. as an erratic trade policy hammers consumer sentiment and sparks worries over growth.】

item.title: 数字广告支出增长，Reddit 预测收入高于预期，股价大涨
item.description: Reddit 周四预计第二季度营收将高于华尔街预期，尽管贸易战持续不断导致营销预算不确定，但该公司仍将赌注押在社交媒体平台数字广告支出的增长上。【原文：Reddit forecast second-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, betting on growing digital ad spend on the social media platform despite uncertainty over marketing budgets resulting from the ongoing trade war.】

item.title: 亚马逊预计季度营收高于预期，云计算增长滞后
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）周四预测的第二季度营收基本高于预期，这是一个令人欣慰的迹象，表明这家电子商务巨头将克服与关税相关的不确定性，但其密切关注的云计算部门的增长却落后于预期。【原文：Amazon.com forecast second-quarter revenue largely above estimates on Thursday, in a reassuring sign the e-commerce giant would navigate tariff-related uncertainty, but growth in its closely watched cloud unit lagged.】

item.title: 随着人工智能订阅服务获得更广泛的吸引力，Duolingo 上调了 2025 年的业绩预期
item.description: 语言学习应用 Duolingo 周四预测本季度营收将高于华尔街预期，并上调了全年销售预期，原因是越来越多的用户付费订阅了具有人工智能功能的软件。【原文：Language learning app Duolingo forecast current-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates and lifted its annual sales expectations on Thursday, as more users pay for subscriptions featuring AI features.】

item.title: 人工智能推动连接需求，Lumen 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 受人工智能密集型工作负载快速增长的推动，企业客户对其连接解决方案的需求强劲，流明科技公司（Lumen Technologies）周四公布的第一季度营收超出华尔街预期。【原文：Lumen Technologies topped Wall Street estimates for first-quarter revenue on Thursday, driven by strong demand for its connectivity solutions from enterprise customers amid a rapid growth in AI-intensive workloads.】

item.title: 数据和消息来源称，最后一艘雪佛龙包租船只开始在委内瑞拉运回石油货物
item.description: 据航运数据和一位消息人士称，雪佛龙公司租用的一艘载有约 30 万桶委内瑞拉石油的船只将于周四开始在委内瑞拉港口卸货。【原文：A vessel chartered by Chevron carrying some 300,000 barrels of Venezuelan oil was set to start discharging at a Venezuelan port on Thursday, according to shipping data and a source.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，欧盟贸易负责人塞夫科维奇：欧洲准备向特朗普提出 500 亿欧元的报价
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周四报道，欧洲贸易专员马罗斯-塞夫科维奇（Maros Sefcovic）表示，布鲁塞尔希望增加从美国购买500亿欧元（约合564.6亿美元）的商品，以解决贸易关系中的 "问题"，并补充说该集团正朝着达成协议的方向取得 "一定进展"。【原文：European Trade Commissioner Maros Sefcovic said Brussels wants to increase purchases of goods from United States by 50 billion euros ($56.46 billion) to address a "problem" in the trade relationship, adding the bloc is making "certain progress" towards striking a deal, the Financial Times reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 据 Axios 报道，特朗普计划于周五公布 2026 财年预算案
item.description: 据 Axios 周四报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普计划于周五公布其 2026 财年预算案，并将其提交国会山。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump plans to release his fiscal year 2026 budget on Friday and will send it to Capitol Hill, Axios reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 乌克兰的金属生产、开发项目和资源
item.description: 乌克兰和美国周三签署了一项由美国总统唐纳德-特朗普大力推动的协议，美国将以优惠条件获得乌克兰新的矿产交易，并为乌克兰的重建投资提供资金。【原文：Ukraine and the U.S. on Wednesday signed a deal heavily promoted by U.S. President Donald Trump that will give the United States preferential access to new Ukrainian minerals deals and fund investment in Ukraine's reconstruction.】

item.title: 美国和乌克兰可能要等十年或更久才能从矿产交易中获得收益
item.description: 乌克兰和美国之间达成的新矿产协议可能需要十年或更长的时间才能产生经济效益，因为投资者在这个饱受战争蹂躏的国家开采新矿面临重重障碍。【原文：The financial payoff from a new minerals deal between Ukraine and the U.S. is likely to take a decade or longer as investors face many hurdles to getting new mines into production in the war-ravaged country.】

item.title: 美国指控医疗保险公司和经纪人实施医疗保险优势回扣计划
item.description: 美国司法部周四提起诉讼，指控美国最大的三家医疗保险公司向经纪人支付了数亿美元的回扣，以换取这些经纪人加入保险公司的医疗保险优势计划。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice filed a lawsuit on Thursday accusing three of the nation's largest health insurers of paying hundreds of millions of dollars in kickbacks to brokers in exchange for enrollments into the insurers' Medicare Advantage plans.】

item.title: 金佰利将投资 20 亿美元扩大美国生产规模
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）推动本地制造的背景下，面巾纸制造商 Kleenex 周四表示，将在五年内投资 20 亿美元扩大在美国的生产能力。【原文：Kleenex tissue maker said on Thursday it would invest $2 billion over five years to expand its manufacturing capacity in the United States amid a push for local manufacturing under U.S. President Donald Trump.】

item.title: Neuralink 的语音恢复设备获得 FDA 的 "突破性 "标签
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的大脑植入公司在社交网站 X 上发文称，Neuralink 已获得美国食品和药物管理局颁发的 "突破性 "标签，其设备可帮助严重语言障碍患者恢复交流。【原文：Neuralink has received U.S. Food and Drug Administration's 'breakthrough' tag for its device to restore communication for individuals with severe speech impairment, Elon Musk's brain implant company said in a post on the social media site X.】

item.title: 消息人士称，埃克森公司与雪佛龙-赫斯交易纠纷的法庭听证会将于 5 月 26 日举行
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，总部设在巴黎的国际商会已定于 5 月 26 日就埃克森美孚对竞争对手雪佛龙计划收购石油生产商赫斯的仲裁纠纷举行听证会。【原文：The Paris-based International Chamber of Commerce has scheduled a hearing in Exxon Mobil's arbitration dispute over rival Chevron's planned acquisition of oil producer Hess for May 26, according to two sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道捷蓝航空的家庭伴侣计划面临工会反弹
item.description: 捷蓝航空公司（JetBlue Airways）与另一家航空公司签署国内合作协议的计划遭到了其飞行员工会的反对，该工会警告说，此举可能会 "从根本上重塑 "这家美国航空公司，并影响其员工的未来。【原文：A plan by JetBlue Airways to sign a domestic partnership with another airline faces opposition from its pilot union, which has warned the move could "fundamentally reshape" the U.S. carrier and impact the future of its workers.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Citadel 旗舰基金惠灵顿四月份增长 1.3
item.description: 一位熟知内情的消息人士周四表示，Citadel 旗舰基金 Wellington 4 月份上涨了 1.3%，度过了一个动荡不安的月份。【原文：Citadel's flagship fund Wellington was up 1.3% in April, as it navigated a tumultuous month, a source familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 优步与 May Mobility 合作在美国城市推出机器人出租车
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies）周四表示，它将与自动驾驶技术初创公司梅移动（May Mobility）合作，在美国各城市的打车平台上部署数千辆自动驾驶汽车，从德克萨斯州阿灵顿市开始，到2025年末部署完毕。【原文：Uber Technologies said on Thursday it will partner with self-driving technology startup May Mobility to deploy thousands of self-driving vehicles on its ride-hailing platform across U.S. cities, starting with Arlington, Texas, by late 2025.】

item.title: 微软和 Meta Platforms 财报发布后，美国科技相关股票大涨
item.description: 在微软和 Meta Platforms 的业绩强于预期之后，包括许多人工智能相关股票在内的美国科技相关股票周四大幅上涨，而投资者则在收盘后等待苹果和亚马逊公司的业绩。【原文：U.S. technology-related stocks including many involved in artificial intelligence rose sharply on Thursday following stronger-than-expected results from Microsoft and Meta Platforms, while investors awaited results from Apple and Amazon.com after the closing bell.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，路威酩轩集团旗下的酩悦轩尼诗将裁员 10
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周四援引路威酩轩集团葡萄酒与烈酒业务部门首席执行官让-雅克-吉奥尼（Jean-Jacques Guiony）的内部视频消息报道称，酩悦轩尼诗集团将裁员10%以上，约1200名员工。【原文：LVMH group's wine and spirits business Moet Hennessy will shrink its workforce by more than 10%, about 1,200 employees, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing an internal video message from the division's CEO, Jean-Jacques Guiony.】

item.title: 英伟达向美国立法者提出对华为不断增长的人工智能能力的担忧
item.description: 据美国国会委员会一位资深工作人员透露，英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋与美国国会议员讨论了对华为科技公司日益增长的人工智能能力的担忧。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang discussed concerns with Huawei Technologies Co.'s growing artificial intelligence capabilities with U.S. lawmakers, according to a senior congressional committee staff source.】

item.title: 哈罗德百货是最新一家受到网络攻击的英国零售商
item.description: 伦敦百货公司哈罗德（Harrods）周四表示，黑客试图入侵其系统，这是继玛莎百货（Marks & Spencer）和 Co-op 集团（Co-op Group）之后，两周内英国零售商遭受的第三次引人注目的网络攻击。【原文：London department store Harrods said on Thursday hackers had attempted to break into its systems, the third high-profile cyber attack on a UK retailer in two weeks, following incidents at Marks & Spencer and the Co-op Group .】

item.title: 据 The Verge 报道，微软准备托管马斯克的 Grok 人工智能模型
item.description: 据 The Verge 周四援引一位熟悉该计划的消息人士的话报道，微软正准备托管埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能模型 Grok。【原文：Microsoft is getting ready to host Elon Musk's Grok AI model, The Verge reported on Thursday, citing a source familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 在美国关税压力下，Xbox 与 PlayStation 一起提高游戏机价格
item.description: 由于美国关税对全球供应链的影响，微软 Xbox 正在提高其游戏机、控制器、第一方游戏和其他配件的价格，竞争对手也采取了类似举措。【原文：Microsoft's Xbox is hiking the prices of its gaming consoles, controllers, first-party titles and other accessories, following similar moves by competitors due to U.S. tariffs impacting global supply chains.】

item.title: 汽车制造商仍可能面临关税带来的 2,000 至 12,000 美元的汽车价格影响
item.description: 总部位于密歇根州的一家经济咨询公司周四表示，尽管白宫对汽车零部件征收的关税有所松动，但汽车制造商仍将面临2,000至12,000美元的价格影响。【原文：A Michigan-based economic consulting group said Thursday that automakers will still face $2,000 to $12,000 price impacts despite softened auto parts tariffs imposed by the White House and retaliatory tariffs.】
